metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24805 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX ofNET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetsnmptrapd40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
libsnmp-base - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
libsnmp-perl - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
libsnmp40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
snmp - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
snmpd - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
snmptrapd - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
tkmib - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.2').
